qas.question: There may be Iron Age findings near Hyderabad, what age are they thought to be from?
What was the Hyderabad region known as under the Chalukya dynasty?
What time period did the Chalukya dynasty rule the Hyderabad region?
When did the Calukya empire split into four?
What was the capital of Golkonda in the mid 12th century?

context: Archaeologists excavating near the city have unearthed Iron Age sites that may date from <a0_0>500 BCE<a0_0/>. The region comprising modern Hyderabad and its surroundings was known as <a1_0>Golkonda (Golla Konda-"shepherd's hill")<a1_0/>, and was ruled by the Chalukya dynasty from <a2_0>624 CE to 1075 CE<a2_0/>. Following the dissolution of the Chalukya empire into four parts in <a3_0>the 11th century<a3_0/>, Golkonda came under the control of the Kakatiya dynasty from 1158, whose seat of power was at <a4_0>Warangal<a4_0/>, 148 km (92 mi) northeast of modern Hyderabad.
